A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Visually impressive.  However storytelling is poor. Also lots of plot holes abd things that just defy the laws of physics. Like bombs dropping in space...hello...no gravity.  And flying Leia is a travesty to the character of Leia and the abilities of Force.  But listen kids...it doesn't have to be good as long as jt makes a lot of money.  

Regarding the SJW aspect\, Kathleen Kennedy needs to walk the walk and not just talk the talk.  Is there not a female director\, screenwriter for the franchise?  

Going in to the film\, my biggest fear was that Mark Hamill's acting abilities would ruin the memory of a much beloved character.  My fears were misplaced.  Hamill did a very good job bringing an aged bedi master to the screen.  It was everythjng else I should have worried about  Han Solo said it best in TFA....the Force doesnt work like that.   Someone should tell Ms. Kennedy how the Force works.

But who cares....it will make a lot of money.  I just hope a great deal of that money goes to supporting the SJW issues the movie puts forth....human trafficking\,  animal cruelty\, science education for women and minorities\, female leadership development.  

On that note\, a big and sincere thank you to George Lucas for his philanthropic support of social issues and education.
